meanings.definition: The state of being vexed or irritated.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints added to the vexednesses in the room.
meanings.sent2: The endless waiting at the doctor's office only increased the vexednesses of the patients.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics brought a touch of vexednesses to the otherwise peaceful household.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved issue lingered in the air, creating a cloud of vexednesses.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules led to a classroom full of vexednesses among the students.

meanings.definition: The quality of causing annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site added to the vexednesses of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with the slow internet connection was a major source of vexednesses for the employees.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending traffic jam was a prime example of vexednesses in the city.
meanings.sent4: The malfunctioning printer was a constant generator of vexednesses in the office.
meanings.sent5: The repeated errors in the report caused a wave of vexednesses among the team members.
